alert.note: Alert for Independence (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 10:17AM CDT until March 27 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Batesville affecting Independence County. White River At Georgetown affecting Prairie, White and Woodruff Counties. White River At Des Arc affecting Prairie County. White River At Augusta affecting White and Woodruff Counties. White River At Clarendon affecting Monroe and Arkansas Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Batesville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, There will be minor flooding of agricultural land along the river. A 15 foot stage at the bridge is equivalent to 23 foot flood stage at Lock One Tailwater staff gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 8.9 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Crest Time Date White River Batesville 15.0 16.0 Sun 9 AM 11.6 9.9 9.2 **FALLING** &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
